alert.note: Alert for Eddy; Lea (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued February 26 at 2:10PM MST until February 26 at 2:45PM MST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Eastern Eddy County in southeastern New Mexico... Lea County in southeastern New Mexico... Western Andrews County in western Texas... Ward County in western Texas... Presidio County in southwestern Texas... Culberson County in southwestern Texas... Northwestern Pecos County in southwestern Texas... Northwestern Ector County in western Texas... Northwestern Brewster County in southwestern Texas... Reeves County in southwestern Texas... Jeff Davis County in southwestern Texas... Western Gaines County in western Texas... Winkler County in western Texas... Loving County in western Texas... * Until 345 PM CST/245 PM MST/. * At 308 PM CST/208 PM MST/, a dust channel was near Mentone, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Satellite imagery, surface observations, and traffic cameras. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 136 and 259. Interstate 20 between mile markers 0 and 84. Locations impacted include... Hobbs, Carlsbad, Lovington, Pecos, Fort Stockton, Monahans, Alpine, Kermit, Eunice, Van Horn, Jal, Marfa, Wink, Kent, Tatum, Toyah, Fort Davis, Candelaria, Mentone and Loving. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
